column4: Hi! Is there a way command lien way to find out a video file's resolution and intended playback aspect? Thanks!
mplayer will tell you that when run from a terminal

Thanks, saw that.... Then I'd like to get that from command line in a script and pass the information over to another process, etc. Is there a "one line output solution", to make sure this always appears in the same place?
there may be some flag for mplayer that does it but i don't know, try reading 'man mplayer'
